text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Arcadia 2001 is an 8-bit console marketed by Emerson Radio in 1982. There are around thirty clones around the world, Bandai realizing its version a year later in Japan with 4 exclusive games including Dr. Slump. It has a Signetics 2650 processor clocked at 3.58 Mhz and 1 KB of RAM. It displays 4 sprites simultaneously, a resolution of 128x208 pixels in monochrome and 128x104 pixels with 9 colors. A beeper produces the sound of the machine. Its toy library will amount to 47 games, in competition with the Atari 5200 and the Intellivision.
